page.title: 05CHURCHES (LAMPHEY)
page.content: The two Church in Wales churches in Lamphey and Hodgeston are the only religious buildings in use in the area. The parish church of Lamphey,St.Tyfai & St.Faith has a Norman tower and font. The church has a peal of four bells and achoir of fourteen members.It was greatly restored in the nineteenth century.The vicar who lives in a modern vicarage opposite is Mr. Adrian Davies. The church is well supported and has various activities for all ages during the week. The church in Hodgeston is a small Norman church with a delightful fourteenth century chancel.It has an interesting piscina and sedilia. There is only a small congregation, no choir or activities.
